head: Head
subj-pronoun-title: (@{subjpronoun}}  Subjective Pronoun [Self] (He, She, it) ect.  HE/SHE/IT attacked with a longsword.
obj-pronoun-title: (@{objpronoun})   Objective Pronoun [Targeted] (Him, Her, Hir, it) ...forcing (him/her/hir/it) to roll his empathy skill to defend against it.
poss-pronoun-title: (@{posspronoun}) Possessive Pronoun [Targeted] (His, Hers, Hirs, its) ...forcing @{targeted|objpronoun} to roll HIS/HERS/HIRS/ITS empathy skill to defend against it.
display-name-title: (@{displayName})  When using character sheet macros should the macro output the target's character name or token name.
w-accurate-title: Gain +10 to Hit when the aim action is used.
w-balanced-title: Gain +10 to bonus to WS Tests when parrying.
w-blast-title: Weapon deals its damage in X meters.  Roll Hit/Damage separately.
w-defensive-title: Gain +15 bonus to Tests to Parry but -10 Penalty when used to attack.
w-flame-title: Deals damage in a 30 degree cone out to the limit of the range.  No roll to hit required.  Those struck must succeed an Ag Test or take damage normally and must make a second Ag Test or catch fire.  Cover does not protect against these attacks.  Flame weapons always hit the BODY and are considered to have JAMMED on an unmodified 9 on the damage dice.
w-inaccurate-title: Gain no bonus to hit when using the AIM action.
w-overheats-title: Roll an OVERHEAT mishap on an unmodified 91+ on the HIT dice.
w-powered-title: Weapon has increased Penetration.  All non-powered weapons have a 75% chance to break when parrying powered weapons.
w-primitive-title: Defenders` armor is doubled against Primitive Weapons.
w-recharge-title: Weapon requires 1 round to recharge (it can only be fired once every two rounds).
w-reliable-title: If the weapon JAMS roll 1d10.  The weapon JAMS only on a natural 10, otherwise treat as a normal miss.
w-sanctified-title: (Blood of Martyrs) Denies Daemonic creatures their double Toughness bonus when they soak damage.
w-scatter-title: If fired within Point-Blank range, gain an extra hit for each 2 degrees of success.  All Armor Points are Doubled when firing at long or extreme range.
w-shocking-title: If target takes at least 1 pt. of damage (after soak), they must succeed a Toughness Test (with a +10 for each point of armor in that location).  If they fail the Test, they are stunned for a number of rounds equal to half the damage they took.
w-smoke-title: Deals no damage by instead creates a cloud of smoke 3d10 meters in diameter from the point of impact.  This lasts for 2d10 rounds (less in adverse weather).
w-snare-title: On a successful hit, Target must make an Ag Test or be immobilized.  To break free, they must succeed a STR or Ag Test.  Target is considered helpless until they escape.
w-storm-title: (Blood of Martyrs) Doubles the number of hits for each shot fired.  Every degree of success (for full auto) or two degrees (for semi-auto) up to the listed fire rate results in two hits even when firing single shots.
w-tearing-title: Roll damage twice and take the highest.
w-toxic-title: Anyone who takes damage from this weapon (after soak) must succeed a Toughness Test (-5 for each point of damage taken) or take an immediate 1d10 points of impact damage to the target with no reduction from armor or toughness.
w-unreliable-title: Jams on a 91+, even if fired on Semi- or Full-Auto.
w-unstable-title: Deals variable damage.  Roll a 1d10.  1: Half Damage; 2-9: Normal Damage; 10: Double Damage.
name: Name
iterative-attacks-title: Add additional attacks for this weapon
weapon-group-name-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_group} ) Group by name for attackbook buttons.  This is mostly used for powercards and sorting weapons on the character sheet.
weapon-class-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_group} ) Describes what class the weapon is, either a melee thrown, pistol, basic, or heavy weapon.
weapon-range-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_range} ) How far a weapon can fire in meters.  A short range is half this number while its long range is double this number.
weapon-RoF-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_RoF}) Give detail on the fire modes available to selected weapon.  The first number indicates if the weapon can be fired singly (with an S).  The second entry indicates if the weapon can be fired semi-auto (the number indcates the shots fireed).  The third entry describes if the weapon may be fired on full automatic.
weapon-damage-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_damage})  The dice roll component of weapon damage.
weapon-damagemod-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_damagemod}) The number added to the damage dice ROLL.
weapon-extradamage-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_ExtDam})  Do not include @{WS} value for melee weapons, this is automatically factored.
weapon-type-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_damType}) The type of damage the weapon deals (E) Energy, (X) Explosive, (R) Rending, or (I) Impact, for the purposes of determining the weapon's critical effect.
weapon-pen-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_pen}) How well the weapon can breech armor and defenses.  The weapon will bypass the target's armor a listed amount.
weapon-proficiency-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_pen}) You trained in the basic use of this class of weapon.
weapon-clip-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_clip}) How many rounds/charges the weapon holds when fully loaded.
weapon-reload-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_reload}) How many actions the weapon takes to reload.  Typically a half or full action some weapons can take a number of actions over several rounds.
weapon-special-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_notes}) This tells if a weapon has a special quality or note which requires the firer or defender to be aware.
weapon-weight-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_weightLBS})  Represents the weight of a weapon.  This value represents its measurement in imperial pounds (lbs).  T switch back to metric measurements deselect `Use Imperial Measurement` on the settings tab.
weapon-weight-abbr-metric: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_weight}) Represents the weight of the weapon in kilograms.  This is the default unit of measurement in Dark Heresy.  To change to lbs, select `Use Imperial Measurement` on the settings tab.
weapon-cost-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_cost}) Indicates the standard value of the weapon within the Imperium.  This is always expressed in Thrones, the de facto currency of the Calixis sector.
weapon-availabilty-titlte: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_availability}) Identifies the weapon's availability (Table 5-3, Core Rules p. 1d6), and the consiquences therein.
weapon-damage-modifier-title: Damage Modifier (@{repeating_weapon_$X_damMod}) Some weapons use the STRENGTH attribute mod for dealing damage.
weapon-type-title: (@{repeating_weapon_$X_wType}) This is the damage type of the weapon.  (E)nergy, (I)mpact, (R)ending, or E(X)plosive.  If you select, none, no damage will be displayed and various non-damage effects will be displayed.
